pullRequest.body:
We change the definition of a `ProperCone` from being a nonempty, closed, `ConvexCone` to a closed, `PointedCone`.
This is mathematically (not definitionally) equivalent to the earlier definition as a `PointedCone` is mathematically (not definitionally) the same as a nonempty, `ConvexCone`.

The definition of `PointedCone` was added after `ProperCone`. Hence, needed to go back and update the definition.

---

nodes.body:
>  a ProperCone is mathematically (not definitionally) the same as a nonempty, ConvexCone.

You mean "a PointedCone is ...", right?
Why the new definition is better than the old one?

> Why the new definition is better than the old one?

There is a natural heirarchy of structures - convex cone, pointed cone, proper cone. 

Also, pointed cones are the best to work with because of their algebraic definition. I'm hoping that a lot of algebra would carry over to proper cones as well by some appropriate coercions.

Looks good to me.

bors d+
Is there a reason these results don't live in the `Pointed` file?

It's because of the import hierarchy. I would need to move `ConvexCone.closure` to the `ConvexCone/Basic.lean` file but then import the required topological spaces stuff there. Right now the only import in `ConvexCone/Basic.lean` is `import Mathlib.Analysis.Convex.Hull`.

Should I move both `ConvexCone.closure` and `PointedCone.closure` to a separate file?
Right now, both of these live in `Cone/ProperCone.lean`
I assume `extends PointedCone` is not allowed here? I think that might be a reasonable feature request to core...

Yes, it throws an error saying `'PointedCone' is not a structure.`

Should I open an issue in the Lean repo? Or just post on Zulip?

```suggestion
lemma toConvexCone_closure_pointed (K : PointedCone 𝕜 E) : (K : ConvexCone 𝕜 E).closure.Pointed :=
```

```suggestion
/-- A proper cone is a pointed cone `K` that is closed. Proper cones have the nice property that
they are equal to their double dual, see `ProperCone.dual_dual`.
This makes them useful for defining cone programs and proving duality theorems. -/
```
